general: This law allows the government to spend money from the country's budget for the financial year ending on March 31, 2009. It also takes money from the Consolidated Fund to pay for these expenses. This act helps the government to cover its spending for that year.

series.short: "Appropriation for Service and Purposes in the UK: £42,200,000,000 Allocated for FY 2008-2009"
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Appropriation (No. 3) Act 2008 authorizes the use of up to £1,000 for the service of the year ending with 31st March 2009.
* Simplified point 2: The Act also authorizes the issuance of £42,200,000,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the same period.
* Simplified point 3: The appropriation applies to the service and purposes specified in the Schedule.

summary: The Appropriation (No. 3) Act 2008 allows the government to spend up to £1,000 for important services like healthcare, education, and defense during the financial year ending on 31st March 2009. This law also lets the government borrow £42,200,000,000 from the Consolidated Fund to pay for these services. This money will be used to fund things like hospitals, schools, and military equipment.
single:
* Authorizes the use of £1,000 for the service of the year ending March 31st, 2009.
* Allows the Treasury to issue £42,200,000,000 from the Consolidated Fund for the same period.
* Appropriates the authorized amount and sum for the specified services and purposes in the Schedule.
* Provides a short title for the Act as the Appropriation (No. 3) Act 2008.
In simpler terms, this legislation authorizes the use of a specific amount of money (£1,000) for government services in the year ending March 31st, 2009. It also allows the Treasury to issue a larger amount of money (£42,200,000,000) from the Consolidated Fund for the same period. The legislation appropriates the authorized amounts for specified government services and purposes, and provides a short title for the Act. This legislation is aimed at providing funding for government services and activities in the specified time period.
